intro: Orthosiphon exilis, commonly known as slender horsegram, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks. Orthosiphon exilis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
